snippet: Antiship cruise missiles could make it more difficult for the United States and its allies to impose a naval embargo, establish a no-fly zone or carry out airstrikes in support of Syria’s rebels.
abstract: American officials say Russia has sent advanced antiship cruise missiles to Syria, move that illustrates depth of its support for the Syrian government led by Pres Bashar al-Assad; Yakhont missile system provides Syrian military formidable weapon to counter any effort by international forces to reinforce Syrian opposition.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Antiship cruise missiles could make it more difficult for the United States and its allies to impose a naval embargo, establish a no-fly zone or carry out airstrikes in support of Syria’s rebels.

headline.seo: Russia Provides Syria With Advanced Missiles
headline.main: Russia Sends More Advanced Missiles to Aid Assad in Syria
headline.print_headline: Russians Send Better Missiles To Help Assad

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
